News

Call for Nominations: Promising Business Relations Practices

In partnership with CSAVR and the NET, the Institute for Community Inclusion (ICI) is conducting research on business relations and employment for people with disabilities served by state vocational rehabilitation (VR) agencies. We are currently accepting nominations of business relations practices used by VR agencies and other employment programs.

Please nominate a practice using this nomination form.

Read More

Can you help us identify emerging practices? We’re looking for ones that:

  • Meet the needs of businesses (for example, dual-customer approach)
  • Promote the employment of people with disabilities

As part of this effort, the ICI is creating a publicly accessible index of practices being implemented by VR agencies, other public or private employment agencies, and businesses.

If you know of any activity or practice that focuses on meeting the needs of businesses and promoting employment for people with disabilities, please let us know. We are looking for innovative practices, either new or longstanding. The nominated practices are not required to be formally established or evidence-based.

Thank you!

Current VR Projects

© ExploreVR.org — ExploreVR is part of the Vocational Rehabilitation Research and Training Center (VR-RRTC). The VR-RRTC is a national center that builds the capacity of the public vocational rehabilitation (VR) program to improve employment outcomes for people with disabilities. The VR-RRTC is funded by the National Institute on Disability and Rehabilitation Research and the Rehabilitation Services Administration of the US Department of Education. Visit the VR-RRTC website (www.vr-rrtc.org) for more information about the center’s policy research, training, and technical assistance efforts.
